metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6162 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
net/core/skbuff.c in the Linux kernel 4.7-rc6 allows local users to cause adenial of service (panic) or possibly have unspecified other impact viacertain IPv6 socket operations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6162` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
